newsitem.title: JAPAN: SOCCER-ANTLERS OPEN J.LEAGUE 2ND STAGE WITH A WIN.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ANTLERS OPEN J.LEAGUE 2ND STAGE WITH A WIN.

text.p: Defending J.League champion and first-stage winner Kashima Antlers kicked off the second-stage competition on Wednesday night with a 3-1 win against Fukuoka Avispa at the southern Japan city of Hakata.
Antlers broke a 1-1 deadlock with an individual goal by Atsushi Yanagisawa in the 72nd minute, before Hisashi Kurosaki added the third goal to crush Avispa's resistance.
After finishing a surprising fourth in the first stage, Hiratsuka Bellmare posted a 7-4 victory over Kashiwa Reysol as Brazilian forward Lopes struck home twice before halftime.
Fellow Brazilian midfielder Jamelli of title contender Reysol also scored a pair of goals in a match that set a new league record of 11 goals.
Nobuhiro Takeda, former Verdy Kawasaki star forward who joined Kyoto Purple Sanga in midseason, scored two goals to lead the team to a 3-2 win over Gamba Osaka.
The league's 17 clubs will play 16 matches in the second stage to be held through October 4.
But national team members will miss more than half of the games because of Asia's final World Cup qualifying round to take place from September to November.
First-stage title holder Antlers will meet the second-stage winner in the two-leg championship series in December to decide this season's overall league trophy winner.
